revised_title: Election Age Trends in the Royal Society
tldr: The authors analyze the age of election to the Royal Society and find that the median age at election has remained consistent over the years. They suggest that 75% of elections should be made by 50 years old to better recognize high scientific merit. The authors also note a backlog of strong candidates who were elected at ages between 65 and 75.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
